Name: sodium sulfite production | sodium sulfite | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Sodium sulfite is produced by treating a suspension of sodium hydroxide or sodium carbonate with sulfur dioxide. ;NaOH + SO2 → Na2SO3 + H2O;The temperature is maintained at 60 – 80 °C for optimal crystal separation. The sodium sulfite suspension formed is centrifuged and the salt dried. Some sodium sulfite is obtained from the scrubbing of SO2-containing off-gases. Production processes using an anhydrous route have not yet achieved industrial importance.
